bow: what are some things you wish you done have done in preparation of baby prior to trying to conceive my husband and have been married years now and have decided to try for child in the next couple of months what are some things we should do prior to trying to conceive what would help make my pregnancy less stressful essentially and leave us better prepared months from then understand finances is big one we re already making list of things we can cut out of the budget to save more money thanks would have made sure our living situation would last we were stuck in rental house run by someone who did care about the house just getting paid it was lot of court nonsense til we showed the oxidized pipe she said was brand new then she apologized and ended the suit not fun with month old take one more big trip by yourselves before you get pregnant get fit and continue to exercise and eat properly throughout the entire pregnancy you are not eating for two you need like 300 extra calories that barely anything do be like me ve gained 100 pounds during each of pregnancies and this last time it is 100x harder to lose it second this gained an appropriate amount of weight but carrying big baby on small frame was very hard on my body wish had built up some extra muscle so could have carried the weight better plus ended up with pih and pre eclampsia so exercise and good eating habits might have saved me section second this had to stay in hospital for days after my little one was born because had high blood pressure do think this would have happened if had looked after myself bit better before and during pregnancy if you like rollercoasters go somewhere like universal studios because you wont get to ride them not only while pregnant but until you kids are old enough big enough to ride too start taking folic acid now and have physical done you can also have them check your immunity levels for things that might require booster like rubella you can also get the chicken pox vaccine if you re eligible also go on some dates sleep and eat out second this whatever big trip you wanted to go on do it before you get pregnant as soon as that baby comes you re not going to be able to travel much or easily for the next well years in and it still difficult even thinking of keeping my little ball of energy still enough to go anywhere fight the fights that most pregnants go through co sleep or crib circ or not cloth or disposable diapers breast or bottle daycare or sahp ages for overnights with family or child friends when you want visitors after birth and how long they can stay that kind of stuff it much easier to figure it out when no one is hormonal or freaking out with our second child my husband and got it out before conception and it was breeze this 100 gained over 90lbs during three pregnancies losing it is hard especially when you re too busy to hit the gym regularly also being in good shape lowers the risk of some pregnancy complications like gd and will make for an easier delivery recovery good one really really wish we had these conversations before the baby and really wish we ironed out plan for each of us getting me time between work amp the baby and fairly dividing up nighttime duties we wound up having lot of messy sobbing am fights early on over things we should have settled earlier make sure you have support system in place because whatever you imagine it will be like it going to be harder amazing but harder conceived my daughter within few months of moving across country and most of my pregnancy was miserable had literally only my partner for support fortunately where live is really great community and by the time my daughter was couple of months old started making some really good friends with other parents but was so isolated and depressed throughout my pregnancy that feel like missed out on the positive parts of it luckily my job keeps me very active constantly moving standing lifting etc but know that cravings will get the best of me they do now and ve never been pregnant we got to go to saint martin last summer was the first trip we took since our honeymoon and got season pass for six flags this year and have taken about trips already and rode everything probably go at least twice more before they close vitamins are big one work overnight shift right now and have been forcing myself to take vitamins just to function even got one of those sunday saturday pill organizers hello 30 going on 70 will look in to folic acid though my shots are all utd thanks to my job this is great list of things for us to figure out together as first time parents thanks agree with everything already posted but would also add deep clean organize declutter the house you may not feel up to it when you re pregnant and you probably wo have chance after baby arrives also my husband and have always been pretty laid back when it comes to housework wish we would have made it more of routine before kids it so much harder to try to establish new behaviors when you re already having to try to learn how to be parent this is important we re inheriting the house we ve been living in for the last ~4 years do think we would have considered children without it sorry that happened to you definitely this start yourself on prenatal vitamin about 3mo before you plan on getting pregnant you need both the folic acid as well as the iron which are generally in regular multivitamin finances do just plan to make cuts and save more money get out of debt make plan for 401k contributions talk about saving on your little one behalf 529 or savings account make sure your vehicles are both safe and in tip top shape buy that one thing you keep saying you need seriously wish we would ve purchased new mattress before lo arrived now it not going to happen for while exercise pelvic floor exercises now and through your while pregnancy wish would ve continued doing squat routine my butt and thighs hurt sooo much after pushing communicate talk about parenting styles division of responsibilities support things that will change plan to continue dating each other child care that does sound awful sorry thankfully we have great support system we re both blessed to have families in laws that we all get along with and get along with each other am an only child so baby is highly anticipated on my side of the family my husband sister is due with her first in october so we ll hopefully have cousins in the same age range too clean your house top to bottom before conception taking about dust the baseboard trim and everything the whole yards felt too tired during my pregnancy to do thorough cleaning and also had wicked morning sickness till week 27 and forget it after baby is born they take up immense amounts of time also get your ducts cleaned out before baby is born it something lot of people never do and if smoker every lived in your house it gets nasty second the vacation and diet sleep all weekend came to say this so important to go into baby making mode feeling rock solid about your marriage and having recently had super fun experience as just the two of you yes this but also be prepared for some of the things you decide and plan on to go out the window once your baby arrives maybe you plan to use crib but little one just will not sleep without you maybe you really want to breastfeed but baby has bad latch or you have low milk supply so it challenging it great to think research talk about it all now but do lock yourselves into plans that could set you up for disappointment edit another thing to consider is how you want to give birth hospital birth center or home midwife doula natural or meds what if you need to be induced or have section we re both very neat people ok well am moreso there is definitely more around the house we could accomplish beforehand though thanks add looking into relevant classes groups in your area as part of support system prenatal yoga was amazing it helped with back and hip pain during pregnancy and also helped prepare my body for labor la leche league is super helpful now came here to say this mom to wonderful month old boy and jeeze miss sleeping had absolutely no idea how long it takes some kids to sleep through the night if you re feeling frisky have boudoir pictures taken your body will never be the same again and it might be fun and sexy to do this for yourself and your husband wear bikini ride roller coasters sleep in as much as you can kegels just note be careful not to eat *too little* too actually *lost* 15 lbs during my pregnancy have no idea what you mean by your body will never be the same again do listen to any negativity you ll never get out of the house your body will be destroyed you ll be broke for the next 18 years personally have great social life since baby came in mothers group and we meet up couple of times week at each others houses with our babies also still have my old friends and while not going out every night of the week the odd times do get out appreciate so much my social life is different not over was quite lucky during pregnancy that really did gain that much weight at all mind you threw up if ate anything in large quantity at all basically had about tiny meals day with help from breastfeeding got back into my old clothes in snap actually thinner now 10 months later than was before thanks to being so busy all day running around minding baby financially actually feel that while things are still tight it is so much easier to budget do know how to explain it since having my son just do find myself spending money frivolously used to be such an impulsive buyer but do know baby popped out and bit more sense popped in being fit will make being pregnant giving birth recovering from giving birth and surviving baby so much easier that the main tip do read everything you see on the internet and if you must do believe it spent countless sleepless night terrifying myself while pregnant reading about the horrors of childbirth but actually ended up having very fast and easy birth kegels and prenatal vitamins ca stress these enough take your folic acid before you even start trying to conceive study up on breastfeeding check out the message boards on kellymom com for insight on the different sort of problems that can arise and ways to tackle them breastfeeding can be exhausting work and you do want to be frantically googling things at am crying and holding wailing newborn not that ve been there this is great everyone thank you for all the responses me and husband have lot to discuss and preparation this is very scary and exciting step in our lives go on last great vacation go into this with your marriage as strong as possible sleep as often as you can nap stay in bed til noon relax and do nothing when you can go ahead and drink that second glass of wine to add on to that you may need to take additional supplements on top of the prenatal had to take iron some stuff though it really hard to decide on before there real live baby in the picture had no idea when overnights would be okay when wanted visitors etc was 100 pro breastfeeding for full year and life happened and made that little more complicated we thought about cloth diapers but realized when we toured daycares that that was not an option in our area it great to have general idea and be on the same page for big picture stuff but keep in mind that you both will need to be flexible have two children year old and year old have slept in 10 years including pregnancy trust me do this *all the time* get out of work at 7am and am meeting the co workers for screwdrivers and bloody marys by 8am on the regular haha wait until actually pregnant to worry about that it kind of specific information to learn before even conceiving feel like you could forget it all before the baby ever comes since you ca exactly practice in the meantime mean things inevitably change after pregnancy and birth stretch marks weight gain change in breast shape are all common changes but as my fiancé says you re not less beautiful after having baby you re just different kind of beautiful start baby proofing now its never too early but it can be too late vacation lots of photos wine and dine eat all the foods you wo be able to once your pregnant start getting into routine of working out most importantly talk to your spouse discuss the important things do leave it until later thits how arguments come about make bucket list look everything on it and cross off the you ca do with baby minimum everything else will have to wait until baby is old enough enjoy life well said gotten an appointment with doctor very early on and insisted on hormone check lost my first baby and required progesterone for few weeks to keep the second one most likely everything will be fine without checkup early but it may pay off to test your hormone levels if had done this might not have had miscarriage might still have but it very realistically could have been progesterone shortage ah guess did really notice ve had stretch marks almost my whole life not to mention that lost weight and stopped getting acne when got pregnant and when started breast feeding it corrected my inverted nipples think my hair even got shinier somehow so after thinking about it rather than say what do you mean maybe my initial reaction should have been why would want to remember looking like *that* it so unpredictable how pregnancy will affect you now that think about it my sister second one left her with hypothyroidism and she gained like 200 lbs when she had been ribs showing skinny before yeah you both need permission to change your minds recently read bitter thread from man whose wife betrayed him by changing her mind about going back to work soon after the baby was born it was horrible to read the reality will be different to your expectations and hormones could change you often for the better making you protective of the baby get your finances in shape get your bodies in shape declutter your house go to lot of movies and sleep in late as often as you can have long drawn out brunches and late dinners look carefully at your health insurance and understand what it covers and what it does get life insurance for both of you get disability insurance for both of you have some hard conversations about the risks of pregnancy what if prenatal testing shows problem what if your baby is not healthy there are necessarily right or wrong answers to these questions but it important to be on the same page very true did mean it in bad way but it the usual experience it sounds like your experience was kind of an outlier which does not at all make it less valid just less common glad pregnancy treated you well hoping that it will help correct my fibromyalgia and it can definitely change your skin and hair texture and stuff even color my moms hair turned curly after her pregnancy even pregnancy is crazy thing that so crazy it strange that nobody ever tells you that things like that can happen wish you luck with your fibromyalgia gt hospital birth center or home midwife doula natural or meds what if you need to be induced or have section head spinning about this bit til about doulas sorry there lot to think about in the end it will happen however it happens and you ll end up with an amazing baby had doula which was super helpful mainly because in country where do speak the language so she was translator and advocate for me probably would have had doula if was still in the us my husband and also agreed ahead of time that if wanted to deviate from the plan of natural unmedicated birth at any time that was fine no judgment for getting an epidural and that if the doctors midwives thought needed section or other intervention to protect me or the baby we would do it we ended up with natural birth and super healthy baby but it was an intensely painful experience left my partner wish had savored small freedoms more drinking hot coffee eating with two hands doing what want when want took that so for granted before my daughter was born she is very good baby and can almost always find time to get things done but it is on her terms for now at least fyi it wo ever be the same but honestly like my post baby body better am 23 and have always been very ah well looked like teenager very tight bodied now my husband says he loves how it feels to make love to *woman* now this could be construed as offensive but really after you have child there just something more grown about you my hips sway and my breasts are pendulous even the circles under my eyes make me look more mature it sounds like idealizing maybe so but enjoy not being mistaken for sixteen year old edit sorry wrote this as if you do have kids reading your other comments it seems you have first and experience my bad house hunting not something you want to do while you re very pregnant same goes with moving and or any remodeling
